context: A known credential theft tool was executed on host `vnevado-win10v` under the account `tgs2z`, indicating an intent to dump credentials. Additionally, a process suspiciously stopped services on this host, likely to avoid detection and facilitate data encryption or destruction. This sequence of malicious activities culminated in an attack that involved a replication request sent from VNEVADO-Win10V to VNEVADO-DC.
question: Which individual was responsible for sending the replication request from VNEVADO-Win10V to VNEVADO-DC?
solution_steps: A credential theft tool was executed using `powershell.exe` command line.
A suspicious process was detected, involving the account with AadUserId `7fcf9695-68fc-4258-864d-e1e5b166c66f`, that stopped services on the device.
A suspected DCSync attack was performed by Julian Burke (IT director) from VNEVADO-Win10V, as he sent 1 replication request to VNEVADO-DC.
